text:
COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA
D.C. Resolution 20-646, effective October 28, 2014

20 DCSTAT 4555

A RESOLUTION

Proposed
Resolution
20-918

To confirm the reappointment of Mr. Joseph Taylor to the Historic Preservation Review Board.

RESOLVED, BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this
resolution may be cited as the “Historic Preservation Review Board Joseph Taylor Confirmation
Resolution of 2014”.

Sec. 2. The Council of the District of Columbia confirms the reappointment of:
Mr. Joseph Taylor
1610 Tulip Street, N.W.
Washington, D.C. 20012
(Ward 4)
as an architect member of the Historic Preservation Review Board, established by Mayor’s
Order 83-119, issued May 6, 1983 (30 DCR 3031), in accordance with section 4 of the Historic
Landmark and Historic District Protection Act of 1978, effective March 3, 1979 (D.C. Law 2144; D.C. Official Code § 6-1103), for a term to end July 21, 2017.
Sec. 3. The Chairman of the Council of the District of Columbia shall transmit a copy of
this resolution, upon its adoption, to the nominee and to the Office of the Mayor.
Sec. 4. This resolution shall take effect immediately.

Historic
Preservation
Review Board
Joseph Taylor
Confirmation
Resolution of
2014
